definitions: unit of thermodynamic temperature equal to 1/273.16 of the triple point of water
examples: The room temperature was measured at 293 kelvin
Scientists prefer kelvin for absolute temperature calculations

definitions: small shelter or house for dogs to sleep in
commercial facility where dogs are housed temporarily while owners are away
examples: The puppy sleeps in a wooden kennel outside
We need to build a larger kennel for the dog
They left their pet at the kennel during vacation
The kennel provides grooming services for all breeds

definitions: fibrous protein that forms the main structural component of hair, nails, feathers, and outer skin layers
examples: Human hair contains large amounts of keratin protein
The keratin treatment made her hair smoother and shinier

definitions: raised edge between a sidewalk and roadway made of stone or concrete
examples: She parked the car carefully against the kerb
The cyclist hit the kerb and fell off

definitions: soft edible part inside a hard shell of a nut or seed
most important or central part of something
core component of an operating system that manages computer resources
examples: Remove the kernel from each apricot before cooking
The corn kernels popped loudly in the microwave
The kernel of truth in his story was hard to find
This paragraph contains the kernel of her argument
The Linux kernel handles all low-level system operations
A kernel update fixed several security vulnerabilities

definitions: thin clear liquid fuel obtained from petroleum used in lamps and heaters
examples: The old lantern still runs on kerosene fuel
They stored kerosene in metal containers for winter

definitions: medication used for anesthesia and pain relief in medical procedures and veterinary medicine
examples: The veterinarian administered ketamine to sedate the horse
Ketamine therapy shows promise for treating severe depression

definitions: thick sauce made from tomatoes, vinegar, sugar, and spices
examples: He squeezed ketchup onto his french fries generously
The children prefer ketchup with their chicken nuggets

definitions: container with a spout and handle used for boiling water
examples: Put the kettle on for some afternoon tea
The electric kettle boils water faster than stovetop

definitions: musician who plays keyboard instruments like piano or synthesizer
examples: The band hired a talented keyboardist for touring
She worked as a keyboardist in several jazz clubs

definitions: hole in a lock where a key is inserted
examples: He peered through the keyhole to see inside
The antique door had an ornate brass keyhole

definitions: main speech given at a conference or event
dominant or central theme of something
examples: The CEO delivered the keynote at the tech conference
Her keynote address inspired the entire audience
Innovation was the keynote of the company's strategy
The keynote of his campaign was economic reform

definitions: set of buttons arranged in a block for operating electronic devices
examples: Enter your PIN using the keypad below screen
The security system has a numeric keypad entry

definitions: central wedge-shaped stone at the top of an arch
most important part on which everything else depends
examples: The ancient arch collapsed when the keystone fell out
Masons carefully positioned the keystone to complete the doorway
Trust is the keystone of any successful relationship
Education remains the keystone of social progress

definitions: dull yellowish-brown color like dust or earth
strong cotton fabric of khaki color used for military uniforms
examples: He painted the walls in a neutral khaki shade
The khaki color blends well with desert landscapes
Soldiers wore khaki uniforms in tropical climates
She bought khaki pants for the camping trip

definitions: title for rulers and nobles in Central Asian and Mongol societies
inn or caravanserai in Middle Eastern countries for travelers
examples: Genghis Khan united the Mongol tribes under his rule
The local khan governed the province for decades
Merchants rested at the khan along the Silk Road
The ancient khan still welcomes travelers today

definitions: dry pellets or chunks of processed food for dogs or cats
examples: The dog eagerly ate his morning kibble portion
Store the kibble in an airtight container

definitions: collective community in Israel traditionally based on agriculture and communal living
examples: She spent a summer working on a kibbutz near Jerusalem
The kibbutz produced organic vegetables for local markets

definitions: payment made to someone who has facilitated a transaction or appointment illegally
sudden backward movement or recoil of something
examples: The contractor was arrested for accepting kickbacks from suppliers
Government officials received kickbacks for awarding contracts
The rifle's kickback bruised his shoulder after firing
Watch out for the kickback when starting the chainsaw

definitions: player who kicks the ball in football especially for field goals
unexpected or surprising element that changes a situation
examples: The team's kicker scored three field goals today
They recruited a talented kicker from college football
The kicker is that she already knew the truth
Here's the kicker - the tickets were free

definitions: action of striking with the foot or leg repeatedly
examples: The baby's constant kicking kept her awake all night
His kicking technique improved after months of practice

definitions: start of a football game when the ball is kicked
beginning or launch of a project or event
examples: The kickoff is scheduled for three o'clock sharp
They won the coin toss and chose to receive the kickoff
The project kickoff meeting is tomorrow morning
We celebrated the campaign kickoff with a party

definitions: informal term for a small child or young person
examples: The kiddie pool is perfect for toddlers
They opened a special kiddie menu at the restaurant

definitions: person who illegally captures and holds someone for ransom or other purposes
examples: Police arrested the kidnapper after a lengthy investigation
The kidnapper demanded one million dollars in ransom

definitions: crime of illegally capturing and holding a person against their will
examples: The kidnapping shocked the entire community last year
They increased security after several kidnapping attempts

definitions: organ in the body that filters blood and produces urine
something shaped like a kidney bean
examples: The patient needed a kidney transplant urgently
Both kidneys function normally according to tests
She wore earrings shaped like tiny kidney beans
The swimming pool had a kidney shape design

definitions: large oven for burning, drying, or firing things like pottery or bricks
examples: The pottery was fired in the kiln overnight
They built a new kiln for making ceramic tiles

definitions: short form of kilogram equal to one thousand grams
examples: She bought two kilos of fresh tomatoes today
The package weighs exactly three kilos

definitions: unit of mass in the metric system equal to one thousand grams
examples: The baby weighed three kilograms at birth
Convert pounds to kilograms by dividing by 2.2

definitions: unit of length equal to one thousand meters or 0.62 miles
examples: The marathon course measures exactly 42.195 kilometers
They walked five kilometers to reach the village

definitions: unit of length equal to one thousand meters or 0.62 miles
examples: The speed limit is 100 kilometres per hour
We drove 300 kilometres to reach the coast

definitions: unit of electrical power equal to one thousand watts
examples: The air conditioner uses two kilowatts per hour
Solar panels generate five kilowatts at peak capacity

definitions: knee-length pleated skirt traditionally worn by men in Scotland
examples: He wore a traditional kilt to the wedding
The bagpiper's kilt swayed as he marched

definitions: good condition or proper balance often used in phrase 'out of kilter'
examples: The machine has been out of kilter since yesterday
Everything seems off kilter after the storm

definitions: traditional Japanese garment with wide sleeves and tied with a sash
examples: She wore a silk kimono to the tea ceremony
The vintage kimono displayed beautiful embroidered patterns

definitions: one's family and relations by blood or marriage
examples: His next of kin were notified immediately
She has no living kin in this country

definitions: school class for young children usually ages 4-6 before first grade
examples: She teaches kindergarten at the local elementary school
The kindergarten students learned their alphabet through songs

definitions: small dry sticks or twigs used for starting a fire
examples: Gather some kindling before lighting the campfire
The dry kindling caught fire immediately

definitions: people with similar interests, attitudes, or characteristics
one's family and relations
examples: She found kindred spirits in the book club
Artists often seek kindred souls for collaboration
He returned to visit his kindred after years abroad
The kindred gathered for the family reunion

definitions: small bright-colored bird that dives for fish in rivers and streams
examples: A blue kingfisher perched on the branch above water
The kingfisher dove swiftly to catch a minnow

definitions: person who has great influence in choosing leaders or making appointments
examples: The party chairman acted as kingmaker in selecting candidates
Media moguls often serve as kingmakers in politics

definitions: leader of a criminal organization or illegal operation
main bolt in a mechanism around which other parts move
examples: Police arrested the drug kingpin after years of investigation
The kingpin controlled operations across three states
The trailer's kingpin connects it to the truck
Replace the worn kingpin to fix the steering

definitions: position, office, or dignity of being a king
examples: He assumed kingship after his father's death
The burdens of kingship weighed heavily upon him

definitions: sharp twist or bend in something like rope or hair
unusual preference or behavior especially of a sexual nature
examples: Work out the kink in the garden hose
Her hair had a natural kink that curled beautifully
Everyone has their own kinks and quirks
The survey revealed some interesting kinks in consumer behavior

definitions: blood relationship or connection between family members
feeling of being close or connected to others
examples: DNA tests can establish kinship between individuals
Their kinship was evident in their similar features
She felt an immediate kinship with her new colleagues
There's a natural kinship between artists and musicians

definitions: male blood relative or member of one's extended family
examples: His kinsman helped him establish the new business
The elderly kinsman left him a substantial inheritance

definitions: small structure or booth for selling things like newspapers or snacks
freestanding computer terminal providing information or services
examples: She bought a magazine from the station kiosk
The kiosk sells coffee and fresh pastries
Check flight information at the airport kiosk
Use the kiosk to print your boarding pass

definitions: destiny or fate especially when viewed as inevitable or divinely determined
examples: Meeting her that day seemed like pure kismet
He believed it was kismet that brought them together

definitions: act of touching with the lips as a sign of affection
examples: The couple was caught kissing under the mistletoe
Public kissing is frowned upon in some cultures
